openOverlayFolder.label: Open Overlay Files Folder
openOverlayFolder.tooltip: Opens the folder where you can find the Uptime.txt and Countdown.txt file that can be included in your overlay.

cdInterval.label: Countdown in minutes
cdInterval.tooltip: Time from where it counts down.

cdTimeFormat.label: Time Format
cdTimeFormat.tooltip:
Set the format of your Countdown here. Available variables:
                    $autoFormat$ = Removes all unnecessary '0' values (5:33)
                    $hh$ = Hours with '0' (05 hours)
                    $h$ = Hours without extra '0' (5 hours, 15 hours)
                    $mm$ = Minutes with '0' (05 minutes)
                    $m$ = Minutes without extra '0' (5 minutes, 15 minutes)
                    $ss$ = Seconds with '0' (05 seconds)
                    $s$ = Seconds without extra '0' (5 seconds, 15 seconds)

cdCustomText.label: Custom Text after Countdown
cdCustomText.tooltip: This text will be used after the Countdown is finished

cdSetCountdown.label: Set countdown chat command
cdSetCountdown.tooltip: This command will be used when setting a new countdown via twitch chat command. E.g. writing "!countdown 300" will set and start a new countdown from 5:00

cdShowCountdownResponse.label: Show countdown response
cdShowCountdownResponse.tooltip:
If turned on, it will display a response message
        e.g. if the broadcaster writes
        "!countdown 300"
        the response message would be
        "New countdown set to 5:00"

customUptimeText.label: Time Format
customUptimeText.tooltip:
Set the format of your Uptime here. Available variables:
        $autoFormat$ = Removes all unnecessary '0' values (5:33)
        $hh$ = Hours with '0' (05 hours)
        $h$ = Hours without extra '0' (5 hours, 15 hours)
        $mm$ = Minutes with '0' (05 minutes)
        $m$ = Minutes without extra '0' (5 minutes, 15 minutes)
        $ss$ = Seconds with '0' (05 seconds)
        $s$ = Seconds without extra '0' (5 seconds, 15 seconds)

maxSleepTimer.label: Max Sleep Timer
maxSleepTimer.tooltip:
Time until the Uptime gets completely reset.
If OBS crashes or the connection to Twitch disconnects the timer will continue where it stopped.

setUptime.label: Set Uptime chat command
setUptime.tooltip:
This command will be used when setting a new uptime via twitch chat command.
E.g. writing "!setuptime 300" will set the uptime to 5:00

showUptimeResponse.label: Show uptime response
showUptimeResponse.tooltip:
If turned on, it will display a response message when a new uptime is set
        e.g. if the broadcaster writes
        "!setuptime 300"
        the response message would be
        "New uptime set to 5:00"
